Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis; interior glazed black with traces of added red bands; exterior:reserved area and band at top; below, black-figure decoration consisting of hind part of boar to left; chest of siren or sphinx to left; incised splinter rosette as filling ornament; possibly some added red on figures.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.799. There are white deposits on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 331, no. B381)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0765) (Phase 1)
